murphquake,"2012-12-19T15:33:52.827Z","The Lego Squirrel you never knew you needed!","

When I first saw these and found out they would be only $4.99 in the
US I was quite excited.&nbsp
column2: A LEGO Friends version of the CMF bags?&nbsp

column1: not quite, there's no mystery, more like Ninjago Booster packs, a figure
and a small build to go with it.&nbsp
column2: I was still stoked, Friends has been

column1: an amazing line for the AFOL who can appreciate a new color or element,
and since you can put most minifigure hats &amp
there's no reason not to have a legion of Imperial FriendsTroopers at
your disposal (yes I said put Stormtrooper helmets on the Friends girls
So what are they?
column2: A series of heavy duty polybags with a

column1: Friends animal and a small home for that animal, in this case a tree
house. This is a great way to get some of the sweet new animal elements
from the Friends line without buying large sets just to get them.&nbsp
Imagine if they did the same with some of the small creatures from Star
Wars!
Box/Instructions
The set is packed in a
thicker plastic than normal polybags, there was no apparent way to open
it, nor does it have the ""cut here"" marks of a CMF packet.&nbsp
to the folding knife i keep in my building area and slit the bottom.&nbsp
From the packet you will find a plastic bag with all the parts and the
instructions folded in half. Overall it's quite nicely packed.&nbsp
instructions are clear, getting Squirrel's Tree House completed in just
10 steps, 2 of which have sub assemblies, and a pair of simple steps for
sticking the bow on squirrel's tail &amp
the build, Acorns!
Parts
The first great thing about this set is by far the
abundance of parts.&nbsp
column2: Imagine all your sets had a 25% ratio of spare

column1: parts to the amount listed on the front of the box?&nbsp
bag lists 41 pieces but my copy had 52!&nbsp
each: reddish brown 1x2 tile, tan 1x2 grille tile &amp
and 2 of each: light azure Friends hair bows, dark pink 1x1 flower
plates, reddish brown &amp
parts for such a small set.&nbsp
column2: The rest of the parts are nice, lime green

column1: 4x4 plates, dark brown 1x2x2 slopes, reddish brown 1x2x3 inverted
slopes 1x2x2 round top window frame &amp
brown dress?), a tan 1x2 brick with 3 section handle and 1x2 plates with
handles on the side, yellow 1x2 plates with clips on the end and 2
small green tree leaves.&nbsp
column2: Overall it's a decent parts pack with not too

column1: many obvious ""Friends colors"".
Minifigures
There aren't any-but there is an awesome
mini-animal!&nbsp
column2: Our new friend Squirrel! He's dark orange with a big bushy

column1: tail with a pin hole at the top for a friend accessory.&nbsp
1x3x2 bricks in size, and will fit on a stud and can then be spun in 360
degrees without contacting the studs surrounding that one.&nbsp
printed with a little smile and blue eyes and is quite cute.
The build
Building the set is quite simple.
you do is take the bright light orange dish and make 2 acorns by placing
a brown 1x1 round plate on top of a tan one.&nbsp
page they sold this set, they look so perfect and are so obviously i'm
surprised that every Autumn MOC isn't littered with these.&nbsp
touch that shows how simple a build can be and still be instantly
recognizable.&nbsp
column2: Next you stick a bow on Squirrel's tail, but I'll be

column1: leaving it off for the most part.&nbsp
column2: I think every one of these sets will

column1: include an animal getting a bow pinned on that's fine with me, especially if
there's going to be 2 spares each time, that's more parts for me to use
in the future, and they totally fit in the holes on the side of Clone
Trooper helmets!&nbsp
column2: After that you quickly build up the little tree house,

column1: it takes just a few minutes, but with a 5-12 age range i can see a
small child enjoying this immensely as it comes together.&nbsp
frame inside to hold the lime plates at the right angle is clever and
will keep kids from being frustrated by the angle they end up at. When
it's done it does look like a little tree house.&nbsp
ramp with the cheese slopes as steps, it's a cute touch.
The completed model
When you're done you have a small little
tree/house and a cute squirrel to live in it.&nbsp
column2: Or you have a new LEGO

column1: Squirrel for your LEGO menagerie and a handful of parts to put in to
your stock.&nbsp
Summary
I know at least one other member of I LUG NY &
Brickset who has been anxiously awaiting these, my only concern being
how to stop myself from buying way more of them than I need.&nbsp
the animals will work their way into sets as well eventually but for now
these are a great impulse buy or a way to pad an order to get special
offers.&nbsp
column2: I know there is at least a 2nd series planned, and hope there

column1: are more after that, with more great new animal molds.&nbsp
see how simple a good set can be.

,TRUE,3,5,4,4,4 Odeinoichus","2013-10-29T19:28:51.91Z","SQUIRREL!","

Set #41017 Squirrel's Tree House: Part of Series 1 Friends Animals the Squirrel's Tree House completes the set of three which I will be reviewing.

The model in this set is pretty clever, I actually enjoyed building this one as much as I did Turtle's Little Oasis. The pieces are a nice combination of colors, brown and beige with light green and of course the dark green plants and pink flower buds. The way you open up the tree house to gain access to the squirrel is rather clever too. I think this would look great next to Olivia's Tree House from 2012.

The squirrel is an interesting piece, it fits the LEGO Friends aesthethic nicely, although I'm not sure how well they'd fit in with other LEGO Animal pieces from conventional Themes. Also of interest is the pink dish included with the set that has some studs built to represent Acorns (I think).

Overall this is a cute little set for Friends fans and collectors of bagged style sets who can get past the 'not actually a polybag' concept. The inclusion of three light blue ribbons is also a nice touch, I'd recommend this set alongside the turtle one before going after the cat's playground series one animal.

Opticus86,"2014-03-28T22:24:34.39Z","Tree House","

This cute little squirrel lives in a really cool tree house!
Box/Instructions
It comes in a polybag with a small instruction booklet.
Parts
With this set you get a nice collection of some very useful parts in interesting colors (like a total of four
column4: plates as well as some useful brown parts if you like to built trees). Another good thing: except the two flower pieces there is no pink in it! :-)

column1: It also comes with a lot of spare parts.
Minifigures
The Squirrel looks very cute, but I don`t like the little hole on the top of its tail (where you can put on the bow). Also its head and eyes are quite big, so it doesn'
column2: t`t look very realistic but is&nbsp
column3: more of a comic-style-squirrel if you ask me.

column1: The build
Nothing special about the build. Nice but short. Good roof structure, that opens up, so it helps for playability.
The completed model
Looks really good and is in my opinion the best (and biggest) set out of friends animals series 1. It really looks like a solid and cool tree house! :-)
Overall opinion
Nice
column2: little build, I`d recommend it. Best model of series 1 one in my opinion.

If you have an animal lover, this set is adorable.
column2: It is an easy build for those younger kids, or those who are easily frustrated. &nbsp
column3: LEGO has done a great job with the animals in the Friends series.

column1: For such a small set, this little squirrel and his home have a lot of character and play-ability.
column2: Great addition to any lego city park or home.
